meanings.definition: To divide into small, uniform units.
meanings.sent1: I will quantize the candies into equal piles for each of you.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to quantize the shapes into equal parts.
meanings.sent3: I tried to quantize my time, but ended up spending too long on one task.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to quantize the room, filling every corner with joy.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes quantized the canvas, creating a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: To approximate a continuous function by a series of discrete values.
meanings.sent1: The scientist needed to quantize the data to make it easier to analyze.
meanings.sent2: The digital signal processor will quantize the audio input for better sound quality.
meanings.sent3: I tried to quantize my thoughts, but they kept flowing like a river.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to quantize the complex emotions into simple expressions.
meanings.sent5: The algorithm will quantize the image to reduce its file size without losing quality.
